intro: Graffenrieda rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are rounded and often have a velvety texture, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
